canonical_explanation.text: Factors of a number divide it exactly without leaving a remainder. Multiples of a number are obtained by multiplying it with whole numbers. Prime numbers have exactly two factors (1 and itself), while composite numbers have more than two factors. HCF is the greatest factor common to two numbers, and LCM is the smallest multiple common to two numbers.
rules: Rule 1: 1 is a factor of every number; every number is a factor of itself
Rule 2: A prime number has exactly 2 factors: 1 and itself. 1 is neither prime nor composite
Rule 3: Divisibility by 2: last digit is 0, 2, 4, 6, or 8. By 3: sum of digits divisible by 3. By 5: last digit is 0 or 5
Rule 4: HCF of two numbers <= each number; LCM of two numbers >= each number
Rule 5: HCF x LCM = Product of the two numbers

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a factor of 36?
questions.explanation_correct: 36 / 9 = 4 with no remainder. So 9 is a factor of 36. 36/7, 36/8, and 36/10 all leave remainders.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A factor divides the number exactly. 36/7=5.14..., 36/8=4.5, 36/10=3.6. Only 36/9=4 is exact.

questions.question_text: How many factors does 24 have?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 24: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. That is 8 factors.
questions.explanation_incorrect: List all factors of 24: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. Count them: 8 factors.

questions.question_text: Which of the following numbers is divisible by 3?
questions.explanation_correct: Sum of digits of 372 = 3 + 7 + 2 = 12, and 12 is divisible by 3. So 372 is divisible by 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Test divisibility by 3: add the digits. 145: 1+4+5=10 (not divisible by 3). 256: 2+5+6=13 (no). 372: 3+7+2=12 (yes!). 430: 4+3+0=7 (no).

questions.question_text: A number is divisible by 6 if it is divisible by both:
questions.explanation_correct: 6 = 2 x 3. A number is divisible by 6 if and only if it is divisible by both 2 and 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Since 6 = 2 x 3, a number must be divisible by both 2 and 3 to be divisible by 6.

questions.question_text: A number ending in 0 is divisible by both 2 and 5.
questions.explanation_correct: A number ending in 0 has its last digit as 0, which is even (divisible by 2) and also satisfies the test for 5 (last digit 0 or 5). So it is divisible by both.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Numbers ending in 0 are divisible by 2 (last digit is even) and by 5 (last digit is 0), so the statement is true.

questions.question_text: Test divisibility: Is 4,56,312 divisible by 4?

options.text: Yes, because the last two digits 12 are divisible by 4
No, because the sum of digits is not divisible by 4
Yes, because it is an even number
No, because 312 is not divisible by 4

questions.explanation_correct: A number is divisible by 4 if its last two digits form a number divisible by 4. Last two digits = 12, and 12 / 4 = 3. So yes, 4,56,312 is divisible by 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Divisibility by 4 depends on the last two digits. 12 / 4 = 3 (exact), so the number is divisible by 4.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a prime number?
questions.explanation_correct: 29 has exactly two factors: 1 and 29. It is not divisible by 2, 3, or 5. So 29 is a prime number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 15 = 3x5, 21 = 3x7, 39 = 3x13 are all composite. 29 is only divisible by 1 and 29, making it prime.

questions.question_text: What is the prime factorization of 60?
questions.explanation_correct: 60 = 2 x 30 = 2 x 2 x 15 = 2 x 2 x 3 x 5. The prime factorization is 2^2 x 3 x 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prime factorization uses only prime factors. 10 and 15 are not prime, so options B and D are not prime factorizations. 60 = 2 x 2 x 3 x 5.

questions.question_text: 1 is a prime number.
questions.explanation_correct: 1 is NOT a prime number. A prime number has exactly two distinct factors (1 and itself). The number 1 has only one factor (1 itself), so it is neither prime nor composite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prime numbers must have exactly two factors. 1 has only one factor (itself), so it does not qualify as prime. It is neither prime nor composite.

questions.question_text: The smallest prime number is:
questions.explanation_correct: 2 is the smallest prime number. It has exactly two factors: 1 and 2. It is also the only even prime number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1 is not prime (only one factor). 0 is not prime. 2 is the smallest prime — it has exactly two factors: 1 and 2.

questions.question_text: What is the HCF of 12 and 18?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. Factors of 18: 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18. Common factors: 1, 2, 3, 6. The highest common factor (HCF) is 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: List common factors of 12 and 18: 1, 2, 3, 6. The greatest among these is 6.

questions.question_text: What is the LCM of 4 and 6?
questions.explanation_correct: Multiples of 4: 4, 8, 12, 16, ... Multiples of 6: 6, 12, 18, ... The smallest common multiple is 12. So LCM(4, 6) = 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: List multiples until a common one is found: 4, 8, 12... and 6, 12... The first common multiple is 12.

questions.question_text: Which divisibility rule applies to check if a number is divisible by 9?

options.text: Sum of digits is divisible by 9

questions.explanation_correct: A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of its digits is divisible by 9. For example, 729: 7+2+9 = 18, and 18 is divisible by 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The divisibility rule for 9 is about the sum of digits, not the last digit. If the digit sum is divisible by 9, the number is divisible by 9.

questions.question_text: Is 5,28,413 divisible by 11?

options.text: Yes, because the alternating sum is 0

questions.explanation_correct: Divisibility by 11: alternating sum = 5 - 2 + 8 - 4 + 1 - 3 = 5. Since 5 is not divisible by 11, the number is not divisible by 11.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For divisibility by 11, compute the alternating sum from right: 3-1+4-8+2-5 = -5, or from left: 5-2+8-4+1-3 = 5. Since 5 is not 0 or a multiple of 11, it is not divisible by 11.

questions.question_text: Which of the following numbers is divisible by 8?
questions.explanation_correct: A number is divisible by 8 if its last three digits form a number divisible by 8. 256/8 = 32 (exact). So 3,256 is divisible by 8.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Check last three digits: 236/8=29.5, 340/8=42.5, 256/8=32, 124/8=15.5. Only 256 is exactly divisible by 8.

questions.question_text: What is the prime factorization of 180?
questions.explanation_correct: 180 = 2 x 90 = 2 x 2 x 45 = 2 x 2 x 3 x 15 = 2 x 2 x 3 x 3 x 5. Prime factorization: 2^2 x 3^2 x 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prime factorization uses only prime numbers. 180 = 2 x 2 x 3 x 3 x 5. Options with 10, 4, or 9 are not prime factorizations.

questions.question_text: How many prime numbers are there between 10 and 30?
questions.explanation_correct: Prime numbers between 10 and 30: 11, 13, 17, 19, 23, 29. That is 6 primes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Check each number: 11(prime), 12(no), 13(prime), 14-16(no), 17(prime), 18(no), 19(prime), 20-22(no), 23(prime), 24-28(no), 29(prime). Total: 6.

questions.question_text: Find the HCF of 36 and 48 using prime factorization.
questions.explanation_correct: 36 = 2^2 x 3^2. 48 = 2^4 x 3. HCF = product of common primes with lowest powers = 2^2 x 3 = 4 x 3 = 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prime factorize both: 36 = 2^2 x 3^2 and 48 = 2^4 x 3. Take lowest powers of common primes: 2^2 x 3^1 = 12.

questions.question_text: Find the LCM of 15 and 20.
questions.explanation_correct: 15 = 3 x 5. 20 = 2^2 x 5. LCM = product of all primes with highest powers = 2^2 x 3 x 5 = 4 x 3 x 5 = 60.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prime factorize: 15 = 3 x 5, 20 = 2^2 x 5. Take highest powers: 2^2 x 3 x 5 = 60.

questions.question_text: The HCF of two numbers is 6 and their LCM is 60. If one number is 12, what is the other?
questions.explanation_correct: HCF x LCM = product of the two numbers. So 6 x 60 = 12 x other number. 360 = 12 x other. Other = 360/12 = 30.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Using the relation HCF x LCM = product of two numbers: 6 x 60 = 12 x n. So n = 360/12 = 30.

questions.question_text: The number 7,65,432 is divisible by 4 because its last two digits form the number ___, which is divisible by 4.
questions.explanation_correct: The last two digits of 7,65,432 are 32. Since 32 / 4 = 8 (exact division), the number is divisible by 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Divisibility by 4 depends on the last two digits. The last two digits are 32, and 32 / 4 = 8 with no remainder.

questions.question_text: What is the HCF of 72 and 120?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prime factorize: 72 = 2^3 x 3^2 and 120 = 2^3 x 3 x 5. HCF = lowest powers of common primes = 2^3 x 3 = 24.

questions.question_text: What is the LCM of 12, 16, and 24?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Take the highest powers of all primes: 2^4 (from 16) and 3^1 (from 12 or 24). LCM = 16 x 3 = 48.

questions.question_text: Every even number greater than 2 is a composite number.
questions.explanation_correct: Every even number greater than 2 is divisible by 1, 2, and itself — so it has at least 3 factors. This makes it composite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An even number greater than 2 has 2 as a factor besides 1 and itself. So it has at least 3 factors and must be composite.

questions.question_text: If HCF(a, b) = 1, the two numbers are called:
questions.explanation_correct: When the HCF of two numbers is 1, they share no common factor other than 1. Such numbers are called co-prime (or coprime) numbers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Co-prime numbers are pairs whose HCF is 1 (e.g., 8 and 15). They need not individually be prime numbers.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is divisible by 5 but NOT by 10?
questions.explanation_correct: 135 ends in 5, so it is divisible by 5. But it does not end in 0, so it is NOT divisible by 10. The others (120, 250, 300) all end in 0 and are divisible by both.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A number divisible by 5 ends in 0 or 5, but divisible by 10 must end in 0. Only 135 ends in 5 (not 0).

questions.question_text: The HCF of any two consecutive numbers is always ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Two consecutive numbers (like 7 and 8, or 15 and 16) always have HCF = 1, because they share no common factor other than 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Consecutive numbers are always coprime. No prime can divide both n and n+1, so their HCF is 1.

questions.question_text: The LCM of 5 and 7 is:
questions.explanation_correct: 5 and 7 are both prime and coprime to each other. LCM of two coprime numbers = their product = 5 x 7 = 35.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Since 5 and 7 share no common factors (both prime), their LCM is simply 5 x 7 = 35.

questions.question_text: A number is divisible by both 4 and 6. It must also be divisible by:
questions.explanation_correct: If a number is divisible by 4, it is divisible by 2 (since 2 is a factor of 4). It need not be divisible by 8, 12, or 24. For example, 12 is divisible by both 4 and 6 but not by 8 or 24.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Divisible by 4 means divisible by 2. While the LCM of 4 and 6 is 12, the question asks what it MUST be divisible by. 2 is guaranteed since it divides 4.

questions.question_text: Express 420 as a product of prime factors.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 14, 4, and 10 are not prime. The correct prime factorization of 420 is 2^2 x 3 x 5 x 7.

questions.question_text: The product of two numbers is 3,600 and their HCF is 30. What is their LCM?
questions.explanation_correct: HCF x LCM = product of the two numbers. So LCM = 3600 / 30 = 120.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Using the formula: HCF x LCM = Product. LCM = Product / HCF = 3600 / 30 = 120.

questions.question_text: Find the HCF of 144 and 180.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prime factorize: 144 = 2^4 x 3^2 and 180 = 2^2 x 3^2 x 5. Take lowest powers of common primes: 2^2 x 3^2 = 36.

questions.question_text: Three bells ring at intervals of 6, 8, and 12 minutes. If they all ring together at 12:00 PM, when will they next ring together?
questions.explanation_correct: They will ring together after LCM(6, 8, 12) minutes. 6 = 2 x 3, 8 = 2^3, 12 = 2^2 x 3. LCM = 2^3 x 3 = 24 minutes. So they next ring together at 12:24 PM.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Find LCM of 6, 8, 12 = 24. They will all ring together after every 24 minutes, so next at 12:24 PM.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is divisible by 11?
questions.explanation_correct: For 9,020: alternating sum from right = 0 - 2 + 0 - 9 = -11. Since -11 is divisible by 11, the number is divisible by 11.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Check alternating sums: 9020: 0-2+0-9 = -11, divisible by 11. Verify: 9020/11 = 820. So 9,020 is divisible by 11.

questions.question_text: Which pair consists of twin primes?
questions.explanation_correct: Twin primes are pairs of prime numbers that differ by 2. 11 and 13 are both prime and 13 - 11 = 2, so they are twin primes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Twin primes differ by exactly 2. Check: 7-3=4, 17-13=4, 23-19=4. Only 13-11=2, so (11, 13) are twin primes.

questions.question_text: Two numbers are coprime and their LCM is 84. If one number is 12, what is the other?
questions.explanation_correct: For coprime numbers, HCF = 1, so LCM = product. Product = 84. Other number = 84 / 12 = 7. Check: HCF(12, 7) = 1 (coprime). LCM(12, 7) = 84.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Coprime means HCF = 1. So LCM = product of numbers. The other number = 84/12 = 7.

questions.question_text: What is the largest number that divides both 70 and 105 exactly?
questions.explanation_correct: 70 = 2 x 5 x 7. 105 = 3 x 5 x 7. HCF = 5 x 7 = 35. So 35 is the largest number dividing both.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The largest number dividing both is the HCF. 70 = 2 x 5 x 7 and 105 = 3 x 5 x 7. Common primes: 5 and 7. HCF = 35.

questions.question_text: Find the smallest number that is divisible by both 18 and 24.
questions.explanation_correct: The smallest number divisible by both is the LCM. 18 = 2 x 3^2. 24 = 2^3 x 3. LCM = 2^3 x 3^2 = 8 x 9 = 72.
questions.explanation_incorrect: LCM(18, 24): take highest powers of all primes. 2^3 x 3^2 = 72. So 72 is the smallest such number.

questions.question_text: The prime factorization of 300 is 2^2 x 3 x 5^___.
questions.explanation_correct: 300 = 4 x 75 = 4 x 3 x 25 = 2^2 x 3 x 5^2. So the missing exponent is 2.

questions.question_text: The LCM of two numbers is 180 and their HCF is 6. If one number is 36, find the other.
questions.explanation_correct: HCF x LCM = product. 6 x 180 = 36 x other. 1080 = 36 x other. Other = 1080/36 = 30.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Using HCF x LCM = product: 6 x 180 = 1080 = 36 x n. So n = 1080/36 = 30.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the first multiple of 13 greater than 100?
questions.explanation_correct: 13 x 7 = 91, 13 x 8 = 104. So 104 is the first multiple of 13 that is greater than 100.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Divide 100 by 13: 100/13 = 7.69... So the next whole multiple is 13 x 8 = 104.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a composite number?
questions.explanation_correct: 51 = 3 x 17, so it has more than two factors and is composite. 37, 41, and 43 are all prime numbers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Check each: 37, 41, 43 are prime. 51 = 3 x 17 is composite (sum of digits 5+1=6, divisible by 3).

questions.question_text: A farmer has 120 mangoes and 150 oranges. He wants to pack them in bags so each bag has the same number of fruits and no fruits are mixed. What is the maximum number of fruits in each bag?
questions.explanation_correct: We need the HCF of 120 and 150. 120 = 2^3 x 3 x 5. 150 = 2 x 3 x 5^2. HCF = 2 x 3 x 5 = 30. Maximum fruits per bag = 30.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is an HCF problem. HCF(120, 150) = 30. So each bag can have at most 30 fruits.

questions.question_text: Two traffic lights blink at intervals of 48 seconds and 72 seconds. If they blink together at 8:00 AM, after how many seconds will they blink together again?
questions.explanation_incorrect: They blink together after LCM(48, 72) seconds. LCM = 2^4 x 3^2 = 144 seconds.

questions.question_text: Is 2,48,622 divisible by 6?

options.text: Yes, because it is divisible by both 2 and 3
No, it is not divisible by 2
No, it is not divisible by 3
No, it is not divisible by either 2 or 3

questions.explanation_correct: Last digit is 2 (even), so divisible by 2. Sum of digits: 2+4+8+6+2+2 = 24, divisible by 3. Since divisible by both 2 and 3, it is divisible by 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Check: last digit 2 (even, so divisible by 2). Digit sum = 24 (divisible by 3). Divisible by both 2 and 3 means divisible by 6.

questions.question_text: The only even prime number is:

options.text: There is no even prime number

questions.explanation_correct: 2 is the only even prime number. It has exactly two factors: 1 and 2. All other even numbers are divisible by 2 and have more than 2 factors.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Every even number > 2 is composite (divisible by 2 and itself and 1). So 2 is the only even prime.

questions.question_text: For two numbers, HCF is always less than or equal to LCM.
questions.explanation_correct: The HCF (greatest common factor) can never exceed the LCM (least common multiple). In fact, HCF divides the LCM. When both numbers are the same, HCF = LCM.
questions.explanation_incorrect: HCF is always a factor of LCM, so HCF <= LCM always. They are equal only when the two numbers are the same.

questions.question_text: The HCF of two prime numbers is always:
questions.explanation_correct: Two different prime numbers have no common factor except 1. So the HCF of two (distinct) prime numbers is always 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prime numbers have only 1 and themselves as factors. Two distinct primes share only the factor 1.

questions.question_text: The LCM of two co-prime numbers is ___ their product.
questions.explanation_correct: If two numbers are coprime (HCF = 1), then LCM = product / HCF = product / 1 = product. So LCM equals their product.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For coprime numbers, HCF = 1. Using HCF x LCM = product: 1 x LCM = product, so LCM = product.

questions.question_text: A number N leaves remainder 0 when divided by 8 and remainder 0 when divided by 12. What is the smallest positive value of N?
questions.explanation_correct: N is divisible by both 8 and 12. The smallest such N is LCM(8, 12). 8 = 2^3, 12 = 2^2 x 3. LCM = 2^3 x 3 = 24.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The smallest number divisible by both 8 and 12 is their LCM = 24.
